did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: United States Army 366th Infantry Regiment and other Colored Divisions Collection, ca. 1940-2015
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection contains collected information pertaining mostly to the 366th Infantry Regiment.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: The 366th served with distinction in World War I and II. It faced combat in World War II in Italy with the 92nd Infantry Division. The unit was notable in that, unlike other segregated units, the officers were not white. While many of the members were African American, individuals with dark skin from other ethnicities were also placed with the 366th.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection contains collected information pertaining mostly to the 366th. Includes publications, photographs and video about the regiment, some from Fort Devens, Fort Dix, and Camp Gifu in Kakamigahara Japan. Also an index with photos of tombstones compiled by James E. Pratt of members who were killed in action. Discs of oral histories and presentations conducted by Pratt about the regiment are also included. Also material relating to the rediscovery of a bell given by the 366th found at the Parrocchia Saint Maria Del Carmine in Apulia. Morning Reports for the 366th from March 1941 through March 1945 compiled by Pratt are also included. These reports detail regiment activity before and during combat. Also lists of rosters and payroll for the various companies and units as well as general orders. Also digital files of bios of soldiers from the unit and digital photographs and press coverage from events in Italy in 2017 involving the unit.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army -- African American troops

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: United States Army 366th Infantry Regiment and other Colored Divisions Collection, #8501. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized.

arrangement.p:
Series I. Books and Documents
Boxes 2-9

Series II. Reproductions of Original Large Format Photographs
Mapcase

Series IV. 8mm Movie Films
Please use DVD copies, not film reels
Box 1

did.unittitle: Series I. Books and Documents
Soldiers of the 366th Infantry Regiment At Rest In Italy

scopecontent.p:
Document compiled by James Pratt containing photos of gravestones and images of soldiers. Identifying numbers correspond to numbers indicated on copies of photographs included in the collection.
See the digital version of the bios for the most up-to-date version.

did.unittitle: Pictorial History 366th Infantry United States Army, Fort Devens, Massachusetts

scopecontent.p: Formerly owned by Elliotte Johnson Williams. Also a reproduction of the 1941 original.

did.unittitle: Company I 366th Infantry by Harold E. Russell, Jr.

scopecontent.p: Memoir published by Rosedog Books.

did.unittitle: No Way Out by Rothacker Smith

scopecontent.p: The War Story of a WWII Black Buffalo Soldier

did.unittitle: La Battaglia di Sommocolonia by Dario Giannini and Vittorio Lino Biondi

scopecontent.p: Includes English translation by Anne Leslie Saunders, Sommocolonia before World War II and The Battle of Sommocolonia.

did.unittitle: Morning Reports of the 366th Infantry Regiment

scopecontent.p: Photo copies of the reports compiled by James Pratt. NARA Approved. These detail activities of the regiment. Some months are broken into multiple parts.

did.unittitle: Series III. Digital Material
Digital files

scopecontent.p: Biographies and digitized photographs of many of the soldiers. Also news coverage and media associated with a 2017 events in Italy with family members of those who served in the 366th, including an event in Sammichele di Bari where the soldiers bought a bell for the church.

did.unittitle: The Dangerous Missions Collection

scopecontent.p: Includes a segment on the 366th.

did.unittitle: Buffalo Soldiers, WWII Home Movies

scopecontent.p: By VFA. Home movies of the 366th Infantry Regiment shot at Fort Devens from 1943-1944. CDV title incorrectly refers to them as Buffalo Soldiers.

did.unittitle: Presentation on the 366th by James Pratt at the Fort Devens Historical Society
366th Infantry Regiment Various Photos

scopecontent.p: High quality scans of photographs, some used in the creation of the reproductions within the collection.

did.unittitle: Interview with Harold E. Russell Jr.

scopecontent.p: Also includes digital photographs.

did.unittitle: Presentation on the 366th by James Pratt at the Publick House, Sturbridge, Massachusetts

scopecontent.p: At War in New England, the 366th Infantry Regiment in WWII.

did.unittitle: Presentation on the 366th by James Pratt in North Yarmouth Maine
Interview with Harold Smith a member of the 92nd Infantry who served in Italy in World War II.

Digitized copies of the movie films from Karen Jamison, including Fort Devens and footage from Japan.
Please use these DVDs instead of the film reels listed below.
Series IV. 8mm Movie Films

scopecontent.p:
Titles are taken from the cans of film, the titles may not be 100% accurate of what is depicted. The films may also have had multiple original reels spliced together to form a new reel. Digitization was done by an outside vendor and placement on DVDs, which may not be in the same order as the reels listed below.
Please use DVD copies, not film reels.
